DOC.brief_summary: This study develop test web-based guide self-help version Acceptance Commitment Therapy ( ACT ) utilize college counseling center ( CCCs ) . ACT evidence-based transdiagnostic therapy find effectively treat range psychological problem . An ACT program would provide mean implement effective treatment range problem CCC setting , guide self-help format would reduce counselor ' workload , improve cost-effectiveness reduce wait list . This would treat student train counselor implement ACT intervention .
DOC.brief_title: Mindfulness Acceptance Applied Colleges Through Web-Based Guided Self-Help ( Phase II )
DOC.detailed_description: Nearly half college student diagnosable mental health problem . College counsel center ( CCCs ) face increase demand service Universities , student , parent meet treatment need student , context increasingly severe case decline resource . Innovative , cost effective solution need improve treatment effectiveness range present problem reduce counselor workload . The current project seek meet need build user-informed guided self-help version Acceptance Commitment Therapy ( ACT ) , evidence-based transdiagnostic therapy find effectively treat range mental health problem target experiential avoidance , tendency avoid unwanted emotion negative thoughts.After program build first stage study , investigator test program several CCCs throughout country . An ACT program would provide mean implement effective treatment range problem encounter CCC setting , online guide self-help format would reduce counselor ' workload client , improve cost effectiveness reduce wait list . This product would treat student series self-help module train CCC counselor implement guide self-help ACT intervention . For current phase ( Phase II ) Small Business Innovation Research ( SBIR ) grant , 8 student self-help session develop , well counselor portal counselor training session review student ' use program receive train implement ACT guide self-help . The current study consist two stage : Stage 1 study user preference test program develop , Stage 2 randomized trial program several CCCs . Stage 1 consist ongoing interview total 6 student , 7 counselor 1 director , contact intermittently throughout program participate web-conference interview provide feedback current development , test individual component program . Development iterative , update adjust base feedback focused interview . Stage 2 consist randomize trial 40 counselor use program , nested program evaluation 400 student ( 10 student per counselor ) . Counselors randomize either ACT College Life program , control website . After complete condition 's training , counselor invite student participate site counselor randomize . Participants condition complete assessment baseline , post , follow-up . The study examine feasibility , efficacy , acceptability program student counselor .
DOC.criteria: ( Stage 1a : Counselor Focused Interviews ) : Currently work CCC previously work CCC 1 year ( Stage 1a : Counselor Focused Interviews ) : Willing spend approximately 9 hour across 57 phone web conference discuss element content webbased program module develop ( Stage 1a : Counselor Focused Interviews ) : Participation comply target enrollment plan ( Stage 1b : Student Focused Interviews ) : Currently treat local CCC , see counselor minimum 4 session . ( Stage 1b : Student Focused Interviews ) : Between age 1825 ( Stage 1b : Student Focused Interviews ) : Willing spend approximately 10 hour across 812 phone web conference session discuss element content webbased , guide selfhelp program module develop . ( Stage 1b : Student Focused Interviews ) : Student currently suicidal homicidal , history psychosis ( Stage 1b : Student Focused Interviews ) : Participation comply target enrollment plan , also include adequate representation participant across various clinical presentation ( Stage 1c : Director Focused Interviews ) : Currently work CCC director , previously work CCC director 1 year ( Stage 1b : Student Focused Interviews ) : Willing spend approximately 9 hour across 57 phone web conference session discuss element content webbased , guide self help program module develop . ( Stage 1b : Student Focused Interviews ) : Participation comply target enrollment plan . ( Stage 2a : Counselor RCT ) : Currently work CCC receive internal/local IRB approval study ( Stage 2a : Counselor RCT ) : Willingness randomize either ACT+TAU Psychoeducation+TAU condition ( Stage 2a : Counselor RCT ) : If randomize ACT+TAU , willingness take ACT guide selfhelp train 4 week prior start Fall 2016 semester , reach pass criterion 80 % ( take approximately 9 hour ) ( Stage 2a : Counselor RCT ) : Willingness attempt recruit 10 student client participate either ACT selfhelp module ( counselor ACT+TAU condition ) psychoeducation website ( counselor Psychoeducation+TAU ) ( Stage 2a : Counselor RCT ) : Willingness monitor student participant recruit long student remain active participant ( potential deactivate student whose continued participation study may contraindicate ) . ( Stage 2a : Counselor RCT ) : Participation comply target enrollment plan ( Stage 2b : Student Program Evaluation ) : Currently treat CCC ( Stage 2b : Student Program Evaluation ) : Students receive counsel ACT+TAU counselor : As covered consent form , willingness participate eight 30minute module part webbased guided selfhelp program complete pre postassessments across period 10 week , OR Students receive counsel Psychoeducation+TAU counselor : As covered consent form , willingness access psychoeducational website complete three set questionnaires : one start study , another set 10 week later , followup set 2 month post . ( Stage 2b : Student Program Evaluation ) : Referred study counselor ; selfrefer ( Stage 2b : Student Program Evaluation ) : Student clinically stable per counselor judgment ( e.g. , suicidal , psychotic , disruptive ) ( Stage 2b : Student Program Evaluation ) : Participation comply target enrollment plan ( Stage 1a : Counselor Focused Interviews ) : Very uncomfortable technology ( Scoring 01 05 Likertlike scale comfort webbased presentation ) ( Stage 1b : Student Focused Interviews ) : Under 18 year old ( Stage 1b : Student Focused Interviews ) : Lack fluency English 7th grade level ( Stage 1c : Director Focused Interviews ) : Very uncomfortable technology ( Scoring 01 05 Likertlike scale comfort webbased presentation ) ( Stage 2a : Counselor RCT ) : None ( Stage 2b : Student Program Evaluation ) : Prior participation formative stage study ( Stage 1B : Student Focused Interviews ) ( Stage 2b : Student Program Evaluation ) : Under 18 year old ( Stage 2b : Student Program Evaluation ) : Lack fluency English 7th grade level .
